;乌克兰当局周三逮捕了一名男子，他们指控该男子帮助俄罗斯指挥导弹袭击乌克兰东部一家受欢迎的披萨店发生爆炸，造成至少 10 人死亡，其中包括三名青少年。

;

;乌克兰国家警察称，周二晚间克拉马托尔斯克发生的袭击造成另外 61 人受伤，这是对一名乌克兰人的最新轰炸。这是俄罗斯在这场长达 16 个月的战争中大量使用的策略。

;

;周二晚间和周三早间的这次袭击以及乌克兰其他地方的其他袭击表明，克里姆林宫并未放松空中攻击，尽管上周末短暂的武装起义造成了政治和军事动荡。

;

;乌克兰并未采取明显的军事行动来利用这场动荡，尽管政府对最近的战场事态发展守口如瓶。它寻求在最近发起的反攻中获得动力。

;

;克里姆林宫因叶夫根尼·普里戈任（Yevgeny Prigozhin）领导的周末叛变而感到震惊，叶夫根尼·普里戈任是瓦格纳私人军队的所有者，该军队由监狱新兵和其他雇佣兵组成，这支军队在俄罗斯发挥了关键作用在乌克兰。这场叛乱是迄今为止对俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京(Vladimir Putin)掌权的最严重威胁。

;

;白俄罗斯总统亚历山大·卢卡申科(Alexander Lukashenko)表示，在俄罗斯表示不会因叛乱而受到指控后，普里戈任于周二流亡邻国白俄罗斯。叛乱。普里戈任的下落无法得到独立确认。

;

;俄罗斯瓦格纳雇佣兵在武装叛乱后返回基地

;

;市议会教育部门表示，14 岁的双胞胎姐妹在克拉马托尔斯克袭击中丧生。它在 Telegram 帖子中写道：“俄罗斯导弹停止了两个天使的心脏跳动。”

;

;据总检察长安德里·科斯廷 (Andrii Kostin) 称，一名 17 岁的青少年也死亡。

;

;地区州长 Pavlo Kyrylenko 表示，袭击还损坏了 18 栋多层建筑、65 栋房屋、五所学校、两所幼儿园、一座购物中心、一座行政大楼和一座娱乐建筑。

;

;救援人员仍在搜寻官员们最初将克拉马托尔斯克的袭击归咎于一枚 S-300 导弹，这是一种地对空武器，俄罗斯军队已将其重新用于对城市进行松散目标袭击，但国家警方后来说，使用了伊斯坎德尔短程弹道导弹。

;

;克拉马托斯克是一座前线城市，乌克兰军队的地区总部就设在这里。记者、援助人员和士兵以及当地居民经常光顾这家披萨餐厅。

;

;乌克兰安全部门表示，他们拘留了一名男子，怀疑他指挥了对餐厅的袭击，该男子是当地天然气运输公司。

;

;安全部门在 Telegram 帖子中称，他为俄罗斯人拍摄了这家餐厅，并向他们通报了该餐厅的受欢迎程度。

;

;它没有提供任何证据证明其说法。俄罗斯在战争期间坚称其不针对平民目标，尽管其空袭造成了许多平民死亡。克里姆林宫发言人德米特里·佩斯科夫周三重申了这一说法。

;

;克拉马托斯克位于顿涅茨克，是俄罗斯去年 9 月声称吞并但并未完全控制的四个乌克兰省份之一。自 2015 年以来，俄罗斯还占领了克里米亚。

;

;部分占领省份中乌克兰控制的部分地区受到俄罗斯轰炸的打击尤为严重，是解决战争的关键障碍。

;

;克里姆林宫要求基辅承认吞并，而基辅则排除了与俄罗斯进行任何谈判的可能性，直到俄罗斯军队从所有被占领土撤军。基辅最近发起了一场备受期待的反攻，以夺回被占领的领土。

;

;瓦格纳的普里戈任如何从普京的朋友转变为军事批评者

;

;与此同时，俄罗斯加强了在基辅的空中打击乌克兰前线的战斗仍在继续。

;

;据乌克兰总统办公室报道，俄罗斯军队周二和夜间还炮击了扎波罗热地区南部的 16 个定居点。

;

;据称，有 77 架前线城镇奥里希夫（Orikhiv）有 1 岁的平民被杀，俄罗斯的炮击在最近被基辅夺回的附近村庄造成了 3 人受伤。

;

;此外，一枚俄罗斯超音速巡航导弹撞上了一群总统府称，乌克兰中部的度假屋引发火灾，导致一名儿童受伤。

;中国大学表示尚未有机会适当考虑一项旨在提出该提案的立法会议员表示，他没有听到其成员的反对意见，因此重组其管理机构。

;

;自由党立法会兼行政会议成员、行政长官李嘉诚顾问张宇人-chiu周三表示，他已与市领导达成共识，推动该机构的彻底改革。

;

;张是大学理事会成员，他提出的私人议员法案旨在修订《香港中文大学条例》，预计周四在立法会进行一读。

;

;但该大学表示，在达成这项私人法案之前，尚未向立法会提供最终草案。立法会发言人表示：“香港中文大学对私人议员法案没有立场，因为它尚未得到正式考虑的机会。”她补充了这段文字本月早些时候，立法者法案的内容“在公布之前并未提交给理事会进行讨论”。

;

;“大学理事会在四月份的会议上审议了一份工作组报告，该报告确定2016 年的模式仍然符合目的。”该发言人表示。

;

;张的法案如果获得批准，将导致该委员会的成员人数从 55 人缩减至 34 人，工作人员与外部代表的比例也将下降大约1:1到1:2。

;

;它还有一项规定，将任命大学副校长的投票门槛从三分之二理事会选票提高到四分之三。

;

; p>;

;工作组提案建议将理事会规模缩小至29人，其中内部成员占11个席位，外部成员占18个席位。

;

;工作组是在有争议的事件发生后由大学理事会组建的。张的提案得到了立法会议员邓家标和刘国勋的支持。

;

;张周三告诉记者，他已向大学理事会展示了该提案自去年11月以来，他坚称自己没有听到任何反对意见。

;

;“如果你问议会，没有人不知道我们在做什么，除非他们不想读， ”张说。 “我绝对确定我没有听到任何人反对。”

;

;大学三人组猛烈要求支付香港私人会员的账单费用

;

;但他承认大学理事会曾没有逐条审查该法案。

;

;张坚称，如果将重组过程留给议会，则需要长达五年的时间才能实现，但使用私人议员法案会将时间缩短为一年年。

;

;他坚称该法案的设计符合报告的建议，但一些理事会成员明确表达了他们的不同意见。

;

;三名理事会成员在上周发布的一封公开信中，猛烈抨击了立法会的建议，该建议将在缩小规模的立法会中保留三名立法会代表，但减少来自其他地区的代表人数。

;

;Enders Lam Wai-hung，该法案的三位作者之一信中，所有由大学大会任命的中文大学毕业生均表示，去年立法会首次提出建议时，他们已提出反建议。

;

;专责小组的咨询也显示出对立法会计划的强烈反对。< /p>;

;“说没有人反对他们的提议是不准确的，”他说。

;

;熟悉情况的消息人士告诉《华盛顿邮报》，该委员会曾试图在下个月召开一次特别会议回应信函撰写者提出的讨论张氏法案的要求。

;

;其中一位消息人士表示，如果立法会决定成立法案委员会来审议该建议，其他人或许可以表达自己的观点和影响力

;

;香港立法会议员希望大学承担私人竞标重组理事会的费用

;

;三名议员还要求大学偿还他们约75万港元（ 95,754 美元），用于支付作为所需立法程序的一部分在宪报刊登该法案的费用。

;

;张表示，当局免除了引入私人议员法案的单独费用。

;< p>;如果一项法案“有利于政府采取措施”，政务司司长可以取消这笔费用。

;

;张补充说，李告诉他，由于繁忙的工作，政府将无法优先考虑大学理事会的改革。立法提案的时间表。

;

;“唯一、最快的方法是我们制定这项私人法案，而不是通过政府，”他说。

;

;李已经同意了私人议员的法案符合香港的小宪法《基本法》，允许立法者提出与公共支出、政治结构或政府运作无关的拟议立法。

;

;李上周二表示，许可是立法会表示“按照既定程序”处理该法案。

;

;三名议员的举动被视为建制派集团对法案的回应。段崇智教授备受争议的连任，他将继续担任大学校长直至 2026 年。

;

;国安法实施后北京官员对香港“软对抗”发出警告辩护律师告诉法庭，生效的法律不应构成针对一家现已关闭的新闻媒体两名前主编的煽动叛乱案的一部分。

;

;辩方还敦促地方法院不要扣押这两人。国务院港澳事务办公室主任夏宝龙表示，《立场新闻》对 2020 年该法实施后仍然存在的极端主义思想和独立议程负有责任。

;

;他们补充说，这些文章中没有任何内容在受欢迎的网站上发布的信息对国家安全构成了重大风险。

;

;周三的言论是在律师桌上口头陈词的第三天也是最后一天发表的，当时审判已接近尾声，在长达 35 天的时间里原定20天的日程。

;

;前总编辑钟培权，53岁和林肇东，35岁，因涉嫌合谋出版和复制煽动性出版物而面临共同串谋指控损害中央政府、地方政府和国家安全法。

;

;法庭还记录了Stand News控股公司Best Pencil HK的无罪答辩，该公司在诉讼中没有代表。

;

; p>;

;检察官最初依靠 17 篇批评北京和香港政府的文章作为证据，证明《立场新闻》煽动了对当局的仇恨和蔑视。

;

;但后来他们将案件扩大到涵盖其他 587 篇文章。此前被调查人员忽视的文章，作为对《立场新闻》进行有偏见报道和鼓吹反政府信仰的指控的一部分。

;

;法院听取了前主编否认《立场新闻》宣扬“激进”香港反对派

;

;检察官表示，数百篇批评国家安全法和中国共产党的报道表明，该通讯社在 2020 年 7 月至 2020 年 7 月至 2020 年 7 月期间刊登最初的 17 篇报道时，意图引导公众舆论支持反对派。 2021 年 12 月。

;

;一份检方文件引用了夏先生今年早些时候的一次讲话，他表示，香港应对“软对抗”和“打着所谓人权幌子进行的反华活动保持警惕”。

;

;首席检察官吴淑娟要求法庭根据夏的陈述对被告定罪，并指出《立场新闻》在隐藏势力仍在继续的情况下刊登了挑衅性的报道威胁国家安全。

;

;但吴的对手、高级律师余若薇辩称，夏只是在评论香港当前的社会政治局势，而不是针对现已不复存在的新闻媒体。

;

;“我们很难理解检方的论点（夏的陈述）是证据，因为他是国家安全专家，”余告诉郭伟健法官，郭伟健得到了市领导李家超的认可。审理此案。

;

;高级律师表示，检察官也未能识别构成其案件支柱的 17 个故事所带来的国家安全风险。

;

;“我们，媒体有义务反映第三方的观点。你不能根据我们所说的来定罪我们，因为我们没有与他们断绝关系。”她说。

;

;法庭获悉，Stand News 没有审查具有“激进”香港观点的博主

;< p>;检方还指出了 45 起单独的法庭案件，其中一些仍在审理中，这些案件可能受到网络媒体的影响。

;

;欧盟要求法官放弃这条“有偏见”的信息，并强调了缺乏证据表明这些案件中的被告受到了 Stand News 出版物的煽动。

;

;法院预计将于 10 月 4 日做出裁决。

;

;煽动叛乱罪可受到最高处罚根据本地法例，首次定罪最高可判处两年监禁。

;

;终审法院认为该罪行可能危害国家安全，案件只能由行政长官批准的仲裁员审理。

;全球最大的 iPhone 工厂已在中国中部城市郑州加大招聘力度据当地报告和劳工中介称，预计 2023 年晚些时候推出新产品。

;

;富士康郑州工厂将为定期返回装配线高峰期的前员工提供 8,000 元人民币（1,105 美元）的奖金据该公司负责生产 iPhone 机械零部件的产品外壳事业部周一发布的招聘启事显示，该公司还鼓励推荐，公司将给予 1000 元的奖励。他们成功推荐的每一位新员工的员工。富士康还向在旺季期间经推荐加入并停留至少四个月的员工提供一次性 7000 元奖金。

;

;这家工厂去年在中国严格的新冠疫情期间生产中断，一位当地招聘人员表示，19号管控期间，目前对工人的需求很高，郑州的招聘机构正在“建立人才库”，为即将到来的旺季做准备。这位姓赵的招聘人员正在招聘正式员工和短期员工，时薪为 21.5 元。

;

;苹果 Vision Pro 供应链中有哪些中国大陆公司？

;

;根据周二的招聘帖子，富士康位于中国南方城市深圳的工厂也为新员工提供高达 6,980 元的奖金。

;

;富士康的招聘热潮即将到来尽管美国和中国之间的地缘政治紧张，但有迹象表明，尽管这家美国科技巨头及其供应商采取措施提高印度和越南等其他国家的产能，但中国仍将是苹果的重要制造基地。

;

;周三，富士康（原名鸿海科技集团）首席执行官兼董事长刘永威在天津举行的世界经济论坛新领军者年会上否认该公司计划将其供应链迁出中国。据民族主义小报《环球时报》报道，中国。

;

;刘今年一直对中国大陆工厂发起魅力攻势，多次访问并与当地官员会面，淡化搬迁传闻。今年 5 月，他对四川省省会成都的工人和官员表示，该公司没有离开这座城市的计划，其拥有超过 10 万名员工的工厂仍然是一个“重要”的生产基地。

;< p>;今年早些时候，刘鹤访问了郑州，为河南省省会郑州的一个新商务中心揭幕。

;

;不过，苹果供应链的多元化仍在发挥作用。据孟买日报《经济时报》今年早些时候的报道，富士康计划在印度最南端泰米尔纳德邦首府钦奈的 iPhone 生产工厂再增建两栋大楼。

; Wed, 28 Jun 2023 22:50:02 +0800 World Economic Forum: Li Qiang boasts of China-tech breakthroughs if wary foreign firms can be swayedhttps://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3225784/world-economic-forum-li-qiang-boasts-china-tech-breakthroughs-if-wary-foreign-firms-can-be-swayed?utm_source=rss_feed

;李强总理呼吁跨国公司加大对华投资力度科技创新领域，外国企业继续就一系列担忧寻求北京方面的保证。

;

;李克强和 120 多名企业代表在闭门会议上交换了一些最紧迫的担忧和要求本周在中国北方城市天津举行的为期三天的年度世界经济论坛（通常被称为“夏季达沃斯”）期间举行。

;

;“我们愿意与周二下午论坛开幕时，李克强在会议上对来自20多个国家和地区的企业代表表示，各方共同推动发展前沿技术，打造合作新领域，开辟企业投资新空间。据中国官方消息，李克强表示，中国可以承诺“巨大的合作机遇”，因为它将通过加强科技创新来实现“新一轮科技产业革命的突破”。

;

;总理渲染中国经济前景，抨击西方“去风险化”

;

;中方声明还称李克强就企业合作、数据管理和气候变化等问题回答了企业代表的提问。

;

;李克强邀请外国企业参与科技领域之际，正值北京在这些领域面临发展的重大瓶颈，包括电信、半导体和飞机，因为它正在应对与华盛顿激烈的科技竞争中的削弱性限制。

;

;自 3 月份以来一直推动中国经济政策的李克强也一直在重复吸引外国投资的言论。中国正试图从长达数年的零新冠政策中恢复过来。

;

;然而，与李会见的外国企业代表表示，他们希望看到中国政府的进一步保证。

;

;德国汽车制造商大众汽车集团驻华首席执行官拉尔夫·布兰德斯塔特(Ralf Brandstaetter)在会议中表示，企业需要更加明确地了解跨境数据传输，并询问在政治紧张局势加剧的情况下，中国计划如何与欧洲合作。

;

;“作为一个全球化的行业，汽车行业的转型高度依赖于人员、数据和知识的国际交流。因此，我们需要对跨境数据传输更加明确。”据路透社报道，该高管表示。据报道，他补充道：“中国的主要考虑是什么，中国将如何与欧洲在这方面进行合作？”中国美国商会会长迈克尔·哈特表示，虽然数据保护是其成员所关心的跨行业问题，许多企业在考虑在中国投资时还面临其他阻碍因素。

;

;“企业很高兴听到这种宏观欢迎。但问题之一是某些类型的投资仍然受到限制。当我们对会员进行调查时，他们告诉我们，如果行业不受限制，他们愿意在中国进行更多投资。”哈特说。 “在某些领域，甚至是金融服务业，理论上是开放的，但要真正实现这一目标，还有一个漫长的过程。”

;

;中国新任总理李强在路

;

;北京今年早些时候承诺放宽实体清单，该清单禁止被视为“不可靠实体”的外国公司在中国从事进出口和投资，作为其增强信心运动的一部分，以确保外国企业的安全投资者认为中国将继续开放市场。但该领域尚未宣布重大变化。

;

;同时，中国企业在获取外国技术方面可能面临进一步限制，而外国企业在中国投资这些领域可能面临越来越大的不确定性，因为美国和欧洲政府坚持认为他们需要“降低”供应链的风险。

;

;布鲁塞尔上周公布的欧洲经济安全战略，将于本周在年度两届会议上进一步讨论日峰会，可能会限制专制政府获得被视为经济安全关键的欧洲技术，例如量子计算和人工智能。

;

;富士康董事长刘永威在小组讨论中谈到亚洲制造业复兴在世界经济论坛上表示，产业链从GDP较高的国家向GDP较低的国家转移是不可避免的，但补充说，这不应被视为进一步的对抗。

;

;“什么中国要做的就是创造更多价值，实现产业转型升级。”苹果最大的iPhone制造商刘说。 “我认为国际社会现在应该更加重视共享合作、共同繁荣。希望分享不要变成封闭，合作不要变成对抗。”

;

;另外，刘向中国小报《环球时报》表示，苹果没有计划将其供应链完全移出中国。

;

; >;

;然而，这家台湾制造商早些时候宣布将加大在中国境外（例如印度）的投资，以满足客户需求并减少对中国生产的依赖。

;

;突袭、限制和艺术of woo：美中贸易如何悬而未决

;

;中国美国商会负责人赫德表示，除了企业最关心的中美地缘政治关系之外，中国近期的经济数据也并没有让企业担忧。有助于增强外国投资者的信心。

;

;“我只想说，如果人们关注的是消费者支出、消费者能力、私人投资，那么这些都是信号。这些事情似乎都没有表明经济会迅速反弹，这让人们有点犹豫。”哈特说。

;

;但是，哈特指出，受地缘政治紧张局势影响较小的行业，例如医疗保健和出于对市场规模的长期考虑，食品和饮料行业似乎仍然比其他行业更有兴趣投资中国。

;

;本月初发布的中国 5 月份最新经济数据显示，工业产出和零售额增长低于市场预期。

;法国“震惊”4 名儿童被刺伤，其中 2 人伤势严重

;

;

;达马宁说，政府将于周三下午召开安全会议，讨论下一步行动。<检察官办公室在一份声明中称，受害者受枪伤并当场死亡。车上的一名乘客被短暂拘留并释放，警方正在寻找另一名逃跑的乘客。

;Are Hong Kong employers prepared for new anti-heatstroke guidelines?

;Lawmaker Lam Chun-sing, also the chairman of the Federation of Hong Kong and Kowloon Labour Unions, said he was concerned about whether construction workers had better rest time under a system that had standardised breaks.

;Donald Trump is doubling down on his legal brawl with E. Jean Carroll, suing the New York author for defamation weeks after a jury held him liable for sexually abusing her.

;

;The former president filed a counterclaim on Tuesday night accusing Carroll of trashing his reputation by publicly accusing him of rape during a May 10 appearance on CNN, despite jurors concluding a day earlier that his actions during the alleged 1996 assault hadn't gone that far.

;

;Trump “has been the subject of significant harm to his reputation, which, in turn, has yielded an inordinate amount of damages sustained as a result,” according to the filing.

;

;A jury of six men and three women last month found that Trump, who is seeking to return to the White House in the 2024 presidential election, was liable for sexual abuse – and not liable for rape – before awarding Carroll US$5 million in damages.

;

;Trump's court filing Tuesday is a counterclaim in a separate 2019 defamation lawsuit Carroll filed against him that is set to go to trial in January. While Carroll won the first trial, Trump has interpreted the verdict as a victory, of sorts, because of the finding on rape.

;

;Video shows Trump defend lewd comments in deposition for rape lawsuit

;

;Carroll's lawyer, Roberta Kaplan, did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

;

;A Trump lawyer had previously been denied court permission to file a counterclaim against Carroll in her defamation case because the request was made too late.

;

;But Trump lawyer Alina Habba argues that a new window for filing a counterclaim was opened earlier this month when Carroll was allowed to amend her defamation complaint after winning the battery trial.

;

;Among other things, Carroll amended her complaint to change every “rape” reference to “sexual abuse.” Carroll also revised the complaint to add Trump's remarks about her at a CNN town hall, where he called her a liar after the trial and accused her fabricating the attack.

;

;When Carroll was asked on CNN a day after the verdict about the jury finding that Trump did not rape her, she falsely claimed otherwise, according to the filing.

;

;“Oh yes he did, oh yes he did,” she said, according to the filing, which says that Carroll made the comments “with an intent to significantly and spitefully harm and attack” the former president.

;

;“The interview was on television, social media and multiple internet websites, with the intention of broadcasting and circulating these defamatory statements among a significant portion of the public,” Trump's lawyers said in the filing.

;

;Carroll went public with her claims in a 2019 magazine article, triggering a wave of sharply worded denials from Trump when he was in the White House, including an assertion by Trump that he could not have raped Carroll because she wasn't his “type” and that she falsely accused him to help Democrats. Those comments are the subject of Carroll's defamation suit that is heading to trial next year.

;;2023.06.28 21:30;
;;

;China's Digital Currency Research Institute, the central bank agency responsible for developing the digital yuan, was too generous in pay rises given to staff in 2020, coming in at eight times the typical ceiling for central government departments, according to an audit report published this week.

;

;Workers at the department under the People's Bank of China received an average salary bump of 27.93 per cent that year, the government's National Audit Office said in its report. It offered a rare glimpse at the inner workings of the organisation that oversees the most widely used central bank digital currency (CBDC) of any major economy.

;

;Seven years after it was established, the agency with the potential to shape the future of money in China offers little information about itself. It has no official website and offers no public data on its payroll size, budget or organisation chart. It was set up with the task of researching a digital currency that was first trialled in 2019 as the Digital Currency Electronic Payment, now widely referred to as e-CNY.

;

;China brings digital yuan machines to Sanya to boost e-CNY use

;

;Since the 2020 pay hikes, the agency's growth appears to have accelerated. Job postings show it kicked off a hiring spree last year. The hundreds of vacancies included positions for Beijing-based software engineers for Google's Android mobile operating system, making up to 70,000 yuan (US$9,700) per month; cloud platform engineers in the eastern city of Suzhou, with a monthly salary of up to 60,000 yuan; and blockchain experts in Shenzhen, with a monthly salary of up to 80,000 yuan.

;

;The institute is one of hundreds of government agencies named in the audit office's report as having financial irregularities. The National Internet Finance Association of China – another agency under the central bank founded in 2016, which was set up to tame the country's online finance firms – was found to have lost 4.65 million yuan on short-term investment products.

;

;Trials of the e-CNY have rapidly expanded over the past four years, but there is still no timeline for an official launch. There are now 26 pilot cities and 5.6 million merchants using China's CBDC, which is accessible through the official app and third-party payment systems like Alipay and WeChat Pay. By the end of last year, 13.61 billion yuan of e-CNY had been spent across a variety of contexts.

;

;In major cities including Beijing, Shanghai and Chengdu, capital of southwestern Sichuan province, subway riders can use e-CNY as a payment option on local transport apps. As of this month, passengers in eastern Zhejiang province are able to use the official e-CNY wallet app to pay for the metro without an internet connection.

;

;Some cities are trialling the use of digital yuan for paying bank loans and utility bills. Changshu, a city of 1.5 million in eastern Jiangsu province, started paying civil servants and employees of public institutions with e-CNY in May.

;

;In the tropical vacation hotspot Sanya, on southern Hainan island, Bank of China, one of 11 banks authorised to handle e-CNY, set up e-CNY foreign exchange machines earlier this month. The ATM-like kiosks allow visitors to deposit 20 different foreign currencies, including US dollars and euros, and receive a physical card loaded with e-CNY to pay for goods at participating merchants, local media reported.

;

;Still, e-CNY adoption appears to be slow-going. The billions of yuan in e-CNY payments is just a fraction of the 500 trillion yuan in mobile payments made in China last year. And for consumers, there is no real difference between e-CNY and traditional payment channels when going through the country's popular mobile payment apps.

;

;In Suzhou, one of the e-CNY's initial test beds, adoption appeared lethargic during the Post's visit in March, with one executive at a local bank saying it was difficult to convince enterprises to adopt the e-CNY because the ecosystem is not fully formed.

;Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen has hailed a key US defence act for its vital role in bolstering the island's security and defence capabilities in the face of growing sabre-rattling by Beijing.

;

;The US National Defence Authorisation Act (NDAA) “plays a vital part in maintaining the security of Taiwan and the Indo-Pacific region”, Tsai told a bipartisan group of US congressmen who reviewed the 2024 version of the law.

;

;“The NDAA continues to include policies and initiatives to assist Taiwan in bolstering its self-defence capabilities and has deepened Taiwan-US security cooperation,” she said, as she met the US delegation in her office on Wednesday.

;

;The nine-strong group, led by Republican lawmaker Mike Rogers, chairman of the House Armed Services Committee, arrived in Taipei late on Tuesday for a three-day visit.

;

;It is “one of the largest US congressional delegations to [visit] Taiwan in recent years”, according to the island's foreign ministry.

;

;Tsai thanked Rogers and the other delegates for their annual work in reviewing the NDAA, and also praised the US Congress for its “long-standing and bipartisan concern it has shown for Taiwan security, and for expressing support for Taiwan through concrete actions”.

;

;Their visit comes amid historic tensions between Washington and Beijing, with the Taiwan “red line” a major bone of contention and regarded as a likely flashpoint.

;

;As exchanges with the US have grown under Tsai, Taiwan has in recent months faced constant military threats from Beijing, including more frequent warplane sorties into the island's air defence zone.

;

;For Beijing, self-governed Taiwan is breakaway territory that must be brought back under its control, by force if necessary, and it sees any overseas exchanges as a violation of its sovereignty.

;

;The People's Liberation Army staged unprecedented live-fire drills following US House speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taipei in August, and also simulated precision strikes and a blockade of the island after Tsai met Pelosi's successor in California in April.

;

;Japan, Philippines, South Korea most open to 'huge disruption' of any Taiwan war

;

;All members of the visiting US delegation were paying close attention to international developments and the challenges facing liberal democracies, Tsai noted during the meeting on Wednesday.

;

;“Serving on the Armed Services Committee, you have continued to protect the national security of the United States and its democratic allies through hearings, bills, resolutions and other active steps,” she said.

;

;The United States, like most countries, does not recognise Taiwan as independent. However, it is a strong supporter of the island and its biggest arms supplier, despite the absence of formal relations, and is opposed to any forcible change in the status quo.

;

;Taiwan-related provisions in the NDAA have gained prominence since the previous US administration of Donald Trump assumed a largely anti-Beijing stance.

;

;Tsai also thanked the Congress for supporting the first part of the US-Taiwan “21st Century” trade initiative signed earlier this month, calling it a milestone move.

;

;“Going forward, we hope to work together with you to promptly and fully address the issue of double taxation that Taiwan and American enterprises and individuals face,” she said.

;

;Taiwan will also continue to work with the US in areas including national defence, in order to jointly safeguard peace and stability in the region, Tsai pledged.

;

;In response, Rogers lauded the “long and important friendship” between the US and Taiwan.

;

;“Our shared commitment to the rule of law, democracy, and a free and open Indo-Pacific has only deepened [that] friendship. As you can see from the delegation with me today, our support for Taiwan is bipartisan and unwavering,” he said.

;

;The delegation is in Taiwan as part of a larger visit to the Indo-Pacific region, and is expected to meet other Taiwanese officials to discuss bilateral relations, regional security, trade and investment, and other significant issues of mutual interest, according to the American Institute in Taiwan, the de facto US embassy.

;

;Rogers is one of five Republicans in the delegation, and the rest are Democrats.

;

;Their visit comes days after the armed services committees of both the House of Representatives and Senate approved the 2024 NDAA, which calls for joint military exercises with Taiwan and comprehensive training of the island's forces.

;

;The US$886.3 billion budgeted for the 2024 version also calls for engagement with Taiwanese officials to expand cooperation on military cybersecurity activities, and support for the island in acquiring defence articles and services to help build up its asymmetric strategies.

;

;The proposals will need final approval from Congress.

;Swire Pacific has agreed the conditional sale of its entire soft drinks business in the US for US$3.9 billion to its UK-headquartered parent company, allowing it to realise a “record gain” of HK$22.8 billion (US$2.91 billion) and focus on the Greater China and Southeast Asia region.

;

;The sale of Swire Coca-Cola, USA to JS&S (Beverages), a unit of John Swire & Sons Limited, Swire Pacific's parent firm, is conditional on the approval of Swire Pacific's independent shareholders, according to a statement issued to the Hong Kong stock exchange on Wednesday.

;

;Should independent shareholders approve the sale, about half of the gain or HK$11.7 billion, would be distributed to shareholders via a dividend of HK$8.12 per A share and HK$1.624 per B share. This “would be larger than the sum of dividends paid over the last three financial years,” according to the filing.

;

;“The significant net proceeds from the transaction will serve to materially reduce the company's net debt, further strengthen its balance sheet and enhance its financial flexibility,” according to the filing.

;

;At the end of last year, Swire Pacific's net debt amounted to HK$56.8 billion, an increase of about 47 per cent from the end of 2021. On Wednesday, Swire Pacific's shares closed 3.67 per cent higher at HK$57.85.

;

;Swire Coca-Cola, USA distributes Coca-Cola and other beverages in 13 states across the Western US, including Arizona, California, Colorado, Idaho, Kansas, Nebraska, Nevada, New Mexico, Oregon, South Dakota, Utah, Washington and Wyoming, serving about 30 million consumers.

;

;“This transaction represents an attractive valuation that results in a gain of around HK$22.8 billion on disposal, the biggest profit ever realised by Swire Pacific,” said Guy Bradley, Swire Pacific chairman.

;

;“This allows us to provide immediate value to our shareholders by returning around half of this gain by way of a special dividend. It is also consistent with our strategic focus on Greater China and Southeast Asia, where we remain committed to executing our exciting investment pipeline.”

;

;The deal's value was about 12.4 times the unit's earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation of about HK$2.46 billion in 2022.

;

;In July, Swire Pacific bought Coca-Cola's bottling operations in Vietnam and Cambodia for US$1.015 billion in cash.

;

;In Asia, Swire Coca-Cola also manufactures and sells Coca-Cola products in 11 provinces and the Shanghai municipality in mainland China. It also serves Hong Kong and Taiwan.
